update.description:
This PR addresses [this comment](#!/osrf/cloudsim-widgets/pull-requests/166/set-and-update-user-budget/diff#comment-37094797) on a PR from the `cloudsim-widgets` repository.

Upon posting a new metrics config, an optional `admin_identity` can be passed. If it exists, it gives read/write permissions to it. This is used to grant permission to the `src-admins` identity upon creation, and avoid depending on callbacks to grant that permission.

A new test case was included, to see if the resource is created and the permissions are correctly set. The previous creation test was modified to check that this field does not exists.

ptal @preyna , @chapulina
fyi @andres_fortier
update.title: Grant permission to optional Admin Identity upon metric creation.

content.raw:
thanks Ger. 
Minor / style: Could you please change the function definition so it looks like the error function above ? Eg. const sendSuccess = function(data, resourceName) ... 
I don't think you need 'r' parameter (similar to error function above). 
I usually see this format when defining inner functions.
After that I think this will be ready to go !
content.html: thanks Ger. Minor / style: Could you please change the function definition so it looks like the error function above ? Eg. const sendSuccess = function(data, resourceName) ... I don't think you need 'r' parameter (similar to error function above). I usually see this format when defining inner functions. After that I think this will be ready to go !

pullrequest.title: Grant permission to optional Admin Identity upon metric creation.

content.raw: this one is tricky :) . This success block should be sent in 2 scenarios: 1) when there is no admin_identify (ie. when the admin_identity permissions block is not executed, from an ELSE). 2) The other is from inside the callback of the admin_identity callback.
content.html: this one is tricky :) . This success block should be sent in 2 scenarios: 1) when there is no admin_identify (ie. when the admin_identity permissions block is not executed, from an ELSE). 2) The other is from inside the callback of the admin_identity callback.

pull_request.title: Grant permission to optional Admin Identity upon metric creation.

pullrequest.title: Grant permission to optional Admin Identity upon metric creation.

content.raw:
Thanks for the review @preyna , I have addressed the comments you left.
Changes include: Not storing the `admin_identity` in the database, moving this extra permission grant into the first permission grant's callback and include two test cases: After creating the identity of TeamC and grant permission to TeamA over it, I make sure that TeamA has access to it and can modify it.
content.html: Thanks for the review @preyna , I have addressed the comments you left. Changes include: Not storing the admin_identity in the database, moving this extra permission grant into the first permission grant's callback and include two test cases: After creating the identity of TeamC and grant permission to TeamA over it, I make sure that TeamA has access to it and can modify it.

pull_request.title: Grant permission to optional Admin Identity upon metric creation.

pullrequest.title: Grant permission to optional Admin Identity upon metric creation.

content.raw: I think the admin_identity should be removed from this pick sentence. Otherwise it will be stored as part of the metrics-config data in the DB. And, afaik, we just want to use this to grant permissions to the admin_identity during creating (and then discard the value. In other words , I dont think this value should be editable in the UI afterwards).
content.html: I think the admin_identity should be removed from this pick sentence. Otherwise it will be stored as part of the metrics-config data in the DB. And, afaik, we just want to use this to grant permissions to the admin_identity during creating (and then discard the value. In other words , I dont think this value should be editable in the UI afterwards).

content.raw: all the remaining lines of code should be part of the body in the above grantPermissions callback . We want these line to be executed only if the previous operation was successful
